official_title: A bill to amend the Shipping Act of 1984 to extend its coverage to certain common carriers providing transportation to or from the United States through ports in nations contiguous with the United States.

summary.text: Cross-Border Cooperation Act of 1986 - Amends the Shipping Act of 1984 to extend its coverage to "contiguous carriers," i.e., certain common carriers providing transportation by water between the United States and a foreign country through ports in nations which are contiguous with the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Shipping Act of 1984 to extend its coverage to certain common carriers providing transportation to or from the United States through ports in nations contiguous with the United States.
